com.emc.atmos.api

Class AtmosConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emc.atmos.AbstractConfig
      • com.emc.atmos.api.AtmosConfig

  • public class AtmosConfig
extends AbstractConfig
    Holds configuration parameters for an AtmosApi instance.

    • Field Detail

        public static final String DEFAULT_CONTEXT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • AtmosConfig

        public AtmosConfig()
        Creates a new instance with default parameters. tokenId, secretKey and at least one endpoint must be provided separately. Intended for use in IoC containers such as Spring.

      • AtmosConfig

        public AtmosConfig(String tokenId,
           String secretKey,
           URI... endpoints)
        Creates a new instance with default parameters and the specified tokenId, secretKey and endpoint(s). This is the minimum configuration necessary for an AtmosApi instance. The secretKey here should be base64 encoded.

    • Method Detail

      • isEnableExpect100Continue

        public boolean isEnableExpect100Continue()
        Returns whether the Expect: 100-continue header is enabled for object write requests

      • setEnableExpect100Continue

        public void setEnableExpect100Continue(boolean enableExpect100Continue)
        Sets whether the Expect: 100-continue header should be used for object write requests. When enabled, all object create and update requests will post the headers first (including Expect: 100-continue) and wait for a 100 Continue response before sending object data. This will allow Atmos to determine if the request is valid before sending a potentially large payload over the network. Default is true.

      • isEnableRetry

        public boolean isEnableRetry()
        Returns whether 500 errors and IOExceptions should be automatically retried.

      • setEnableRetry

        public void setEnableRetry(boolean enableRetry)
        Sets whether 500 errors and IOExceptions should be automatically retried. When enabled, these requests will be retried up to maxRetries times with a retryDelayMillis ms delay between retry attempts. Default is true.

      • getMaxRetries

        public int getMaxRetries()
        Returns the maximum number of retry attempts before bubbling the exception back to calling code.

      • setMaxRetries

        public void setMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
        Sets the maximum number of retry attempts before bubbling the exception back to calling code. Default is 2 retries.

      • getRetryBufferSize

        public int getRetryBufferSize()
        Returns the buffer size used for non-repeatable object content (input streams) when retry is enabled.

      • setRetryBufferSize

        public void setRetryBufferSize(int retryBufferSize)
        Sets the buffer size used for non-repeatable object content (input streams) when retry is enabled. Once the amount of data transferred surpasses this number, the request can no longer be retried. The implementation may be as simple as calling inputStream.mark( bufferSize ), so input streams that do not support mark might not be retried. Default is 1MB.

      • getRetryDelayMillis

        public int getRetryDelayMillis()
        Returns the delay in milliseconds to wait between retry attempts.

      • setRetryDelayMillis

        public void setRetryDelayMillis(int retryDelayMillis)
        Sets the delay in milliseconds to wait between retry attempts. Default is 0 (no wait).

      • getSecretKey

        public byte[] getSecretKey()
        Returns the secret key as a byte array.

      • setSecretKey

        public void setSecretKey(byte[] secretKey)
        Sets the secret key as a byte array.

      • setSecretKey

        public void setSecretKey(String secretKey)
        Set the secret key from a base64 encoded string (this is the format typically provided to users)

      • getServerClockSkew

        public long getServerClockSkew()
        Returns the estimated clock skew between the local machine and the Atmos cloud (if set).

      • setServerClockSkew

        public void setServerClockSkew(long serverClockSkew)
        Sets the estimated clock skew between the local machine and the Atmos cloud. This number can be calculated by calling AtmosApi.calculateServerClockSkew(). Implementations should set this automatically on their local config instances when this method is called.

      • getTokenId

        public String getTokenId()
        Returns the full Atmos token ID

      • setTokenId

        public void setTokenId(String tokenId)
        Sets the full Atmos token ID

      • getProxyUri

        public URI getProxyUri()
        Returns the HTTP proxy used for communication to Atmos

      • setProxyUri

        public void setProxyUri(URI proxyUri)
        Sets the HTTP proxy used for communication to Atmos

      • getProxyUser

        public String getProxyUser()
        Gets the username to use for the HTTP proxy

      • setProxyUser

        public void setProxyUser(String proxyUser)
        Sets the username to use for the HTTP proxy

      • getProxyPassword

        public String getProxyPassword()
        Gets the password to use for the HTTP proxy

      • setProxyPassword

        Sets the password to use for the HTTP proxy
